Erk.. This is really ugly... And the pull doesn't even state who needs this functionality or why.\n
@rebroad Basically this makes Core a blockchain-only node and disables off-chain transactions.\n

@rebroad It's fairly self explanatory. If you want to run a node that only processes blocks (e.g. don't care about unconfirmed transactions); you can set this and save ~80% of your bandwidth, including all redundant transmission of block data; "Blocksonly". This is good for many applications (including my laptop... :) )\n

Ah, I thought I had raised a pull request for my Antisocial fork, but it seems not. I think it would be useful to have an option to do blocksonly during IBD only.  Would this be of interest to anyone?\n
